qa_data.question: Rufus Giwa Polytechnic Acceptance Fee
qa_data.answer: The Rufus Giwa Polytechnic acceptance fee is the amount of money that you need to pay to confirm your acceptance of the admission offer. The acceptance fee for the 2025/2026 academic session is N15,000 for both full-time and part-time students. To pay the acceptance fee, you need to follow these steps:
qa_data.keywords: rufus, giwa, polytechnic, acceptance, fee

qa_data.question: How to Pay Rufus Giwa Polytechnic Acceptance Fee
qa_data.answer: To pay the acceptance fee, you need to follow these steps: You must pay the acceptance fee within two weeks of receiving the admission offer, otherwise, you risk losing your admission. You must also pay the acceptance fee before you can pay the school fees. ” Also ReadRufus Giwa Polytechnic Cut-Off Markfor Admission ”
qa_data.keywords: how, pay, rufus, giwa, polytechnic, acceptance, fee

qa_data.question: Rufus Giwa Polytechnic School Fees Payment
qa_data.answer: To pay the school fees, you need to follow these steps: You must pay the school fees before the deadline announced by the management, otherwise, you will incur a late payment penalty or forfeit your admission. You must also pay the school fees before you can participate in academic activities, such as lectures, tests, and exams.
qa_data.keywords: rufus, giwa, polytechnic, school, fees, payment, pay

qa_data.question: How to do course registration as a fresher?
qa_data.answer:
1. Check your admission status on the RUGIPO portal >> Pay the acceptance fee, then pay for Admission Letter > Pay for Bio-Data and Verification of Result. 

2. After payment & verification. Log in to the portal and navigate to Course Registration.

3. Select select courses, submit, print and visit your HOD's office to sign your course form.
qa_data.keywords: course registration

qa_data.question: What are the registration steps for new students?
qa_data.answer:
Step 1: Check Admission Status
Input your UTME/Application Number to verify your status from https://studentportal.rugipo.edu.ng/.

Step 2: Payment for Acceptance Fee
Only admitted candidates can proceed to pay the mandatory acceptance fee.

Step 3: Admission Letter
Pay for and print your official admission letter after acceptance fee payment.

Step 4: Verification of Result
Complete the payment for result verification to finalize registration.
qa_data.keywords: registration steps, new students registration

qa_data.question: How to apply for Rufus Giwa Polytechnic Admission?
qa_data.answer:
ADMISSION INTO FULL/PART TIME PROGRAMMES
Applications are currently being accepted from suitably qualified candidates for admission into National Diploma (ND) and Higher National Diploma (HND) Programmes for the 2025/2026 Academic Session.

To Apply, click on this link(https://studentform.rugipo.edu.ng/) then follow these steps:

Step 1: Choose Form Option
Select either HND, ND for Full-time or Part-time programme.

Step 2: Complete Admission Screening Form Registration
Jamb Year	
JAMB No	
SurName	
FirstName
OtherName
JAMB Score	
Phone Number	
Email Address
Faculty	
Department	
Course Option

Step 3: Proceed to Payment
After filling the form, click on the submit button and proceed to payment.

Step 4: Download Print Out
Once your payment has been confirmed, a PDF print out will be available to download. Save it and wit for further instructions!
qa_data.keywords: rufus giwa polytechnic admission, rugipo admission, apply for rufus giwa ND programme

qa_data.question: What are the admission requirements for Civil Engineering?
qa_data.answer:
For Civil Engineering at Rufus Giwa Polytechnic (RUGIPO), you'll generally need 'O' Level credits in Math, Physics, Chemistry, and English, plus another relevant science/technical subject (Biology, Further Math, etc.)

Also, you must have nothing less than 150 as your current JAMB score
qa_data.keywords: admission requirements, civil engineering, civil

qa_data.question: Rufus Giwa Polytechnic School Fees for Full-Time and Part-Time Students
qa_data.answer: The Rufus Giwa Polytechnic school fees for full-time students range from N70,000 to N90,000, while the school fees for part-time students range from N80,000 to N100,000. The school fees for the 2025/2026 academic session vary depending on the faculty and course of study. qa_data.answer: Rufus Giwa Polytechnic hostel fee is N10,000 (ten thousand naira only) per academic year for both male and female students. The hostel fee covers bed space and maintenance. qa_data.answer: The fee structure at Rufus Giwa Polytechnic offers students affordable access to quality tertiary education. Rufus Giwa Polytechnic tuition fees range from N70,000 to N100,000 across the institution’s various National Diploma and Higher National Diploma programs. qa_data.question: What are the rule and regulations for Rufus Giwa Polytechnic exams?
qa_data.answer:
Eligibility Rules for Exam:

1. Pay all required fees: School fees, acceptance, verification, and registration must be fully paid.

2. Complete course registration: Only students who have registered their courses can sit for exams.

3. Provide required documents: You may need your ID card, fee-receipt, or exam slip at the hall entrance.

Rules Before the Exam:

1. Arrive early: Late entry may not be allowed or may reduce your available writing time.

2. Check the timetable: Confirm your exam venue and time ahead.

3. Sit only at your allocated seat: Avoid switching seats unless approved by the invigilator.

Prohibited Items in Exam Hall:

1. No phones or electronic gadgets

2. No notes, papers, textbooks, or written formulas unless permitted.

3. No bags

Conduct in the Exam Hall:

1. Maintain silence: Talking or disturbing others is not allowed.

2. Follow invigilators’ instructions

3. No impersonation: Sitting for another student is a serious offence.
qa_data.keywords: rules and regulations, exam rules

qa_data.question: What is the Approved Calendar For 2025/2026 Academic Session
qa_data.answer:
The Acting Rector, on behalf of the Academic Board, has approved the Academic Calendar for the 2025/2026 Academic Session as follows:

FIRST SEMESTER

Mon. 17 Nov. 2025 – Resumption & Registration of Fresh Students / Hostel Allocation

Fri. 28 Nov. 2025 – Orientation of Fresh Students

Mon. 24 Nov. 2025 – Resumption of Returning Students (excluding SIWES)

Mon. 8 Dec. 2025 – Commencement of Lectures (All Students)

Fri. 30 Jan. 2026 – Matriculation Ceremony

Fri. 27 Feb. 2026 – End of Lectures

Mon. 2 – Fri. 20 Mar. 2026 – First Semester Examinations

Fri. 15 May. 2026 – End of First Semester

SIWES STUDENTS

Mon. 2 Mar. – Fri. 1 May. 2026 – Lectures

Mon. 4 – Fri. 15 May. 2026 – Examinations


SECOND SEMESTER

Mon. 25 May. 2026 – Resumption of All Students

Mon. 25 May – Fri. 14 Aug. 2026 – Lectures

Mon. 27 – Fri. 31 Jul. 2026 – Students’ Union Week

Mon. 17 Aug. – Fri. 4 Sept. 2026 – Semester Examinations

Fri. 4 Sept. 2026 – End of Academic Session

This was contained in a circular to the Polytechnic community, signed by Mr. A. I. Ayodeji, Director of Academic Affairs.

All students and staff are advised to take note and comply accordingly.
qa_data.keywords: Academic Calendar
